page.title: 14TRANSPORT
page.content: There is only one way to get to Camber and that is by road, and there is only one road, the C24, which goes through the village from Rye to Lydd. During the summer buses run every hour,in the winter every two hours, with no buses on Sunday, The fare to Rye is 75p single and Â£1,00 return. In the summer coach firms bring holiday makers to the camps, and also arrange trips to the continent and to places of interest in the area. Many of the residents have private cars, and the majority of the people who visit Camber come by car, which cause considerable snarl-ups at peak times, when the car parks and every available place in the village is full, the road on the return journey home is chock-a-block for miles.
